channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024030615
item.description:
Report X-2024030615

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A LARGE STYROFOAM BOX BROKE OPEN ON ONE SIDE CAUSING DRY ICE TO FALL OUT FROM THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED LESS THAN FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING A FIVE GALLON PAIL OF PINEAPPLE JUICE CONCENTRATE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024030330
item.description:
Report E-2024030330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: MINNESOTA COMMERCIAL RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Union Pacific Railroad delivered TILX 202905 to the Minnesota Commercial Railway. During the inbound inspection, it was found that the car had some product coming out of the top when sloshing. No product was hitting the ground. The MNNR refused interchange on the railcar and notified the Union Pacific Railroad of the discovery. The Union Pacific hired Rybak Environmental Inc. to look at the car and clean up the side of the car. Upon inspection by Rybak, it was discovered that the car was missing a manhole gasket.

item.title: Report X-2024030627
item.description:
Report X-2024030627

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS INFORMED THAT THERE WAS A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMMING FROM SOME HAZMATS ON THE IRREG / HAZMAT UNLOAD ROLLERS. INSPECTING THE HAZMAT PACKAGES ON THE ROLLERS RESPONDER FOUND 1 WITH BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 HAZARD DIAMONDS THAT SEEMED TO HAVE A STRONG ODOR BUT NO WET CORNERS ON THE BOX. OPENING THE BOX RESPONDER FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND LOOSE.

Report X-2024030473

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: ROGERS

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Origin station repacked this package without declaration, with the evidence being that all four bottles were found in a smalls bag inside the outer box. Package was discovered damaged at destination station yesterday morning on the inbound. Someone placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: three bottles leaked from vented caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2024021644
item.description:
Report X-2024021644

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: DULUTH
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wisconsin Central Railroad Ltd.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CN Transportation employee observed liquid coming from the top of tank car TILX 726166 while performing switching operations at the CN Proctor yard, Duluth, MN. The employee notified the employee in charge who then notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team and CN Environment to investigate. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location and found (2) of the (6) manway cover swing bolts to be loose (could turn by hand) preventing a proper seal of the gasket allowing the contents to leak out when the car moved. Both the liquid and vapor line vale securement plugs were found tool tight. The shipper security seals were found to be intact at the time of inspection. The security seals were removed from the manway cover and the protective housing cover. The manway cover was opened to inspect the gasket which was found to be in good condition. The manway cover was closed, and all swing bolts were properly tightened. The valve securement plugs were inspected and found tool tight. New security seals were applied. The exterior of the tank car was cleaned off utilizing a degreaser and rags.

item.title: Report E-2024030231
item.description:
Report E-2024030231

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XEN experienced a UN1139 Bright Kure & Seal release from (2) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 15' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents were then collected into a second 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
